page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO DEWSBURY
page.content: Bywell, Chickenley and Eastborough schools joined in the survey of the eastern half of the market town of Dewsbury(pop.40,000)and part of Ossett(20,000).Eastborough is a town centre school,Bywell is surrounded mainly by private houses whilst Chickenley is in the middle of a large council estate.Dewsbury,situated in the Calder valley,was once the centre of the heavy woollen industry.The textile trade declined however,and many mills have been converted to other uses.The textile industry attracted many workers from India and Pakistan and there is a large immigrant community in Dewsbury. Dewsbury lies close to the M1 and M62 motorways.It has a new bus and police station,sports centre and shopping precinct,while 1985 saw the start of its new ring road.
